text:
I don’t want to block that at all, and I’d still like you to consider the additional time with me. That is consistent with all the professional guidance I
have, including things that Dr Brown told us both.
I have always said I want them to enjoy this trip. Always. I just want to do it in a safe and responsible way. So my hope is you will listen to professional
advice and meet in the middle for the boys sake.
Let me know if you have questions!
Message 3451 of 4024
BTW- can we just establish up front if we are going to work together today on knocking out any issues? I realize you are busy and so am I, so don’t
want to get wrapped around a sprocket waiting for a reply to a proposal or something and have you dark for 12 hours. It will just frustrate me if you
say something is urgent and tune out. Happy to establish a check in time if that works to make decisions. Thanks!
Sent:07/05/2024 at 08:02 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 07/05/2024 at 10:19 AM)
Subject:Re: July 4th
Message 3452 of 4024
I am driving to Whistler today, with a car full of kids.
I understand you have our counter proposal for the temp proposal.
For Hong Kong, I am unaware of any conditions that would make it unsafe or irresponsible, which you state below are your concerns.
Sent:07/05/2024 at 10:22 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 07/05/2024 at 10:27 AM)
Subject:Re: July 4th
Message 3453 of 4024
I don’t know what you are talking about. Can we chat real quick? I’m really trying to bust stuff out asap.
Sent:07/05/2024 at 10:28 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 07/05/2024 at 10:34 AM)
Subject:Re: July 4th
Message 3454 of 4024
I informed you I was trying to get everything done for you today.
You yelled demands at me instead of listening and hung up again.
This will, unfortunately, slow things down, but that is your choice.
Sent:07/05/2024 at 10:47 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 07/05/2024 at 07:36 PM)
Subject:ToDo List
